intro: Echites subcarnosus, commonly known as the hairy echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echites subcarnosus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry and nutrient-poor soils.
